{"step_by_step_thinking": "The development of the tongue involves several structures. The tuberculum impar is a midline structure that contributes to the formation of the tongue. The hypobranchial eminence is a swelling in the floor of the pharynx that gives rise to the posterior part of the tongue. The lingual swellings are lateral swellings that contribute to the anterior part of the tongue. The arytenoid swellings, on the other hand, are not involved in the development of the tongue. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Arytenoid swellings.", "answer_choice": "D"}
